sub-events.comment: Search two columns (LowerBound and UpperBound) in a DataSet for a match where a search value falls between the LowerBound and UpperBound. If a match is found then the RowIndex for the matching row is returned.
Params: DataSetUID, LowerBoundColumnIndex, UpperBoundColumnIndex, SearchValue
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
LowerBoundColumnIndex: The index of the lower bound column to search for the matching value.
UpperBoundColumnIndex: The index of the upper bound column to search for the matching value.

SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value must be numeric and will be compared to see if it is greater than or equal to OR lesser than or equal to the lower and upper bound values for each row.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index

Search two columns (LowerBound and UpperBound) in a DataSet for a match where a search value falls between the LowerBound and UpperBound. If a match is found then the value of a column in that row is returned.
Params: DataSetUID, LowerBoundColumnIndex, UpperBoundColumnIndex, SearchValue, ReturnColumnIndex
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
LowerBoundColumnIndex: The index of the lower bound column to search for the matching value.
UpperBoundColumnIndex: The index of the upper bound column to search for the matching value.

SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value must be numeric and will be compared to see if it is greater than or equal to OR lesser than or equal to the lower and upper bound values for each row.
ReturnColumnIndex: The index of the column to return a value from when a match is found.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index
Search a column in a DataSet for a matching value. If a match is found then the value of a column in that row is returned.
Params: DataSetUID, ColumnIndex, SearchValue, ReturnColumnIndex
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to search for the matching value.
SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value is checked to see if it is numeric and if so then its type is converted to an Int before the comparison is made.
ReturnColumnIndex: The index of the column to return a value from when a match is found.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index

Search a column in a DataSet for one or more values that CONTAIN a piece of text. For each match found the RowIndex for the matching row is added to the ResultSet. The return value for the function is the number of matches founds.
Params: DataSetUID, ColumnIndex, SearchValue
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to search for the matching value.
SearchValue: The value to be searched for.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index
Return the count of the number of matches found

Search a column in a DataSet for one or more matching values. For each match found the RowIndex for the matching row is added to the ResultSet. The return value for the function is the number of matches founds.
Params: DataSetUID, ColumnIndex, SearchValue
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to search for the matching value.
SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value is checked to see if it is numeric and if so then its type is converted to an Int before the comparison is made.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index
Return the count of the number of matches found
Search a column in a DataSet for a matching value. If a match is found then the RowIndex for the matching row is returned.
Params: DataSetUID, ColumnIndex, SearchValue
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to search for the matching value.
SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value is checked to see if it is numeric and if so then its type is converted to an Int before the comparison is made.
Search a column in a DataSet for a matching value. If a match is found then the RowIndex for the matching row is returned.
Params: DataSetUID, ColumnIndex, SearchValue
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to search for the matching value.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to search for the matching value.
SearchValue: The value to be searched for. This value is checked to see if it is numeric and if so then its type is converted to an Int before the comparison is made.
No matching row found yet so just increment the index
Create a new row at the end of the DataSet
Params: DataSetUID, + 1 param for each column in the DataSet
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to add a row to
Updates a column in a row for a given DataSet
Params: DataSetUID, RowIndex, ColumnIndex, Value
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to update
RowIndex: The index of the row to update.
ColumnIndex: The index of the column to update.
Value: The new value.
Delete a row from the DataSet
Params: DataSetUID, RowIndex
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to delete a row from
RowIndex: The index of the row to delete
Clears all rows from the DataSet leaving it empty and ready to add new rows
Params: DataSetUID
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to delete all rows from
Returns the number of rows in the given DataSet
Params: DataSetUID
DataSetUID: The UID of the DataSet to get the count of rows from
Given a value will either return that same value as a string of text, an integer number, or a float number
Params: Value
Value: The value to format into a specific type
If type is a String of text
Else is either a Int or a Float number
Is an Int number
Determines if a value can be interpreted to be a number
Params: Value
Value: The value to be evaluated
Formats a number into a string of text with commas
Formats a number into an American English string of text with commas, a period for cents and a dollar sign
